name: Yoshimo - The Bounty Hunter - Fighter 20 / Rogue 19 / SD 1
author: Pope

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Mighty ECBers!

Today I come to you with a great collaborative project that @Stagmeister and I have been working on. The idea was to rework Yoshimo for Neverwinter Nights, without losing his essence. But, like I said in the Edwin Odesseiron topic, he's the perfect example that something has to give when making character adaptations between different systems. So, instead of going: "this is the only possible interpretation", we decided to post two interpretations, each one abdicating one aspect of the original BG character.

In Baldur's Gate, Yoshimo was a bounty hunter, with the set snare ability. This part is easy to translate to NWN: Trap skills. However, he was more of a dex-based finesse kind of fighter, who dual-wielded Katanas. This aspect of his character is sadly not translatable to NWN, as Katanas aren't finessable, and dual-wielding feats give severe penalties when the off-hand weapon is larger than small (tiny for small races). So, I decided to build him without the feats, but in a way that was tweakable to include them if necessary. It isn't as easy to include these feats, but you could drop your starting STR to 16, then raise your DEX to 15, and then move 4 Fighter levels to pre-epic, drop 1 Great Strength and either Epic Prowess or Armor Skin, and Toughness pre-epic to take the dual-wielding feats. You lose 1 damage this way. I made him STR-based just because you can see the weapons in his portrait, and I couldn't see him without the "samurai" look he had in game. Then you can either dual-wield Katanas or dual-wield a Katana and a Kukri, without the WF feats on the off-hand weapon, unfortunately. Or you can switch to sword / board when necessary. The point of making this adaptation was to leave room for options. You also have the option to drop Listen and add points to bluff, cuz he was a two-faced bastard LOL, and a bit of UMD to reach 33. I prefer to drink a CHA potion if I need to cast from scrolls. 

Meanwhile, on his end, Stag worked on a dual-kukri DEX-based version of Yoshimo, for those who prefer to relinquish his trademark Katanas, but keep everything else about him. We went back and forth via e-mail optimizing both builds, until these final versions were reached. In the end, even if it's not a SINGLE build, surely one of them will resonate with Yoshi's fans as the closest to him one could get in NWN. Stag will post his build just below this one, so if you could please wait until he does so to post any comments, I'd appreciate it. All in all, I could see both builds being Yoshimo. 

Ladies and Gentlemen, please welcome Yoshimo to our halls!

Thanks, Max!

So, much against type, I got to build the dexterous Yoshimo (with excellent assistance from Max), going for volume of attacks rather than instant impact. I did, however, keep exotic weapons, even if they can't be katanas. As Max says, he's a bounty hunter, and if he's going to do his job, he needs to be a sneaky, elusive trapper, so this is just an alternative take. We did take the same overall class split, just with a different implementation. Hopefully you'll find all the Yoshimo you could ever want here!

Further thanks to Max for being the trigger and the encouragement.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content: These are great builds and ones that I like to play. Only issue I have is crippling strike coming so late...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks, gkorjax!

I hear you about Crippling Strike. But everything has a price, and to bring it in earlier means one of several things. 1) Swap it with one of Imp Evasion/ Def Roll/ ED, but that means delaying ED to level 40 (surely not a good idea). 2) Lose SD for another Rogue level and so a late skills dump, but that means delaying your epic combat feats and losing HiPs (though you would gain 2 pre-epic feats). Again, not a trade I fancy.  3) Take ED as a general feat, but that means losing 1 Great Dex, so you'd have to drop another one (maybe for a Great Str to up damage by +1). You'd also lose 1 AB, 1 AC, and 1 to your Reflex save. Another price I'd rather not pay.

So, taking earlier Crippling Strike is do-able, but just because you can doesn't mean you should. At least it does feature in the build!

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Sorry, there is another way to take Crippling Strike earlier. Change your starting stats to 12 STR and 12 CON, bumping DEX to 18. That way you can take ED as a general feat at level 30 and CS at 31. You keep the same final DEX (losing 1 Great Dex feat) and have another Rogue BF at level 40 (Slippery Mind or Skill Mastery, maybe). You lose 40 hps and 1 Fort save, as well as a little carrying capacity. Might that one work for you @gkorjax?

Cheers

Very well-spotted! I actually made that same suggestion on Stag's DEX build, but I had already posted mine when I spotted it. In the STR build, your suggestion can be used for 2 things:

1- Get 2 Great Strengths by taking Armor Skin and EWF with Fighter bonus feats and gain +1 damage; or

But also, that would make it a bit more complicated to tweak him and include the 2wf feats if that's how you saw Yoshimo. I'll edit the OP to include your suggestion. 

I also used the opportunity to swap Spot and Listen, because on WoG, True Seeing adds to Spot. Feel free to take Listen in places with unmodified True Seeing.

Hey SP!

I'm glad you liked the build. Not trying advise you not to take DevCrit, but here's why I didn't go for it. You're a STR-based character with a very good weapon and lots of d6 of Sneak Attack dice to add to your attacks, so you'll really only struggle against Sneak-immune enemies, which are also crit-immune, except for Dwarven Defenders. Plus the DC isn't really that spectacular with only 34 STR, so I'd prefer the extra BAB to DevCrit on this one.

YMMV.

Cheers!
